channel.title: MYB
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from MYB, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Trust, Technology, Human Factors: The Foundation Of Cyber Resilience
item.description: There is a need for increased Trust in this era of swift technological progress, where AI, automation, and deepfakes are threatening the cybersecurity...

item.title: Netflix And PayPal Users Warned As Matrix Hackers Attack
item.description: Netflix and PayPal users have been warned to stay alert, as Matrix Push hackers are targeting them via compromised browser notifications.

item.title: 3 Hidden Messages Your Jealousy Is Giving You, By A Psychologist
item.description: Jealousy can be seen as emotional metadata. It is its own emotion, yes, but also a message carrier for deeper and shier emotions that struggle to make...

item.title: Just How Different Are Women’s And Men’s Brains? It’s Complicated
item.description: What does neuroscience tell us about the differences between women's and men's brains? The story isn't as clear as you may think.

item.title: It’s Called ‘Seasonal Drift,’ Or The Science Behind A Warmer Thanksgiving
item.description: Thanksgiving feels warmer, winter might be colder, what "seasonal drift" has to do with weather confusion and how we are adapting.

item.title: On meeting spec
item.description: The most useful definition of quality: It meets spec. The hard part isn’t putting in enormous effort to somehow beat the spec. The hard part is settin...

item.title: Infantilization
item.description: The worst sort of powerlessness happens when we’re seduced into doing it to ourselves.

item.title: A convincing argument
item.description: It’s almost never exclusively based on logic. We navigate the world with stories, beliefs and assumptions. And the people you’re trying to persuade ha...

item.title: Hard work and goodwill
item.description: The other day, Tom Cruise gave a long acceptance speech. But unlike every other speech of its kind, there were no notes. No rambling. No false starts....

item.title: Kinds of stealing
item.description: Most cultures are built around the idea of private property. Grain is harvested once a year and stored for months. If someone steals the grain (which ...
